phrases: I had lost my way during my journey.
Only my soul was wandering, while I stood still.
But right now, I am walking to a distant place.
That is right, ever since I met you on this road.
The travellers witnessed the song, the forbidden song,
And I became attached to it as I heard it alone with you.
If the world I saw in my dreams exists somewhere,
Let us go search for it, beyond the winds.
Whether it is a freezing dawn,
A dry midday,
A shivering night,
or the ends of the Earth, let us go and see it.
Once upon a time in a village,
an abundance of wheat would ripen and sway in the wind,
and a wolf could be seen running through it.
Wheat that fell due to the wind would be trampled on by the wolf.
When the crop was poor, the wolf would then eat it.
There was nothing in the beginning.
There was only warmth.
And then, a promise was made.
Meetings and partings continued.
Eventually, humans gained wealth using their own power.
There was probably no need to keep the promise faithfully anymore.
Wolf and Best Clothes
I am getting awfully tired of these countryside roads.
Are not you?
You are a peddler?
If you head south for half a day, there is a small village in the mountains.
I just came back from selling salt there.
So, all of that is salt?
No.
This is fur.
It is just a stack of wheat.
It is strong in the heat and cold.
What is going on?
Since when has it become this daunting?
Truth be told, a pagan festival is about to start in a village to the south.
Pagan?
They do not believe in the one and absolute God.
They are an outrageous folk.
I think the law enforcement should use their power more like they did in the past.
It seems they are just not as devoted.
The pagans are probably using some cheap trick.
Pagans, huh?
The people of Pasroe?
Hey, Lawrence.
Boy, I am really surprised.
I did not think there was a different method for harvesting.
It is all thanks to the Count.
We cannot rely on the wolf anymore.
Hey, we cannot say bad things.
It is a god, after all.
Oh, Lawrence!
Hello!
It is been such a while!
No, no, you came at a really great time.
Tomorrow is the harvest festival.
Tomorrow?
I thought it had already begun.
Actually, we are just a bit ahead here.
How about a cup?
Hey, hey, do not drag Lawrence into this one!
Well, forgive my rudeness!
By the way, do you know where Chloe is?
Chloe?
I see, so that is what it is about, huh?
No, she is just my merchant apprentice, after all.
I just thought we would have a drink
and talk about trade while we were at it.
Well, that is not good.
That place is the final spot for the harvest this year.
She might be the one to become Horo for the festival.
Over there!
That is where the wolf lies!
So who is going to catch the wolf in the end?
Just who?
Who?
Chloe!
Lawrence!
You came!
Horo will escape if you look away!
It is the last stack of wheat.
Did your greed hide the wheat stack?
Check it well, or Horo will escape!
So, who caught the wolf?
Who?
It was Chloe!
Chloe!
Chloe!
Horo the wolf appeared!
Catch her!
Catch her!
She headed that way!
Catch her, Lawrence!
It is been a while, so treat me tonight, okay?
What do you mean, treat me tonight?
You will be in there for a week!
Thanks to you, a new trade route has opened up for us.
It sounds like Chloe's doing well as the village's merchant.
Yes, she is doing really well.
This village will continue to prosper.
Thoreni silver coins?
I have not seen these in this area, though.
We can say goodbye to those dark, rusty silver coins.
We will see the day when we rub shoulders with people in the big city soon.
No, we still have a long way to go.
It is all thanks to the new feudal lord, Count Eirin Dotte.
There is no need to pray to the wolf anymore.
We can overcome droughts and storms thanks to our own abilities now.
Rather than Thoreni silver coins, we will be making Rumio gold coins!
I hope for your patronage when that time comes.
Outsiders will just be treated as a nuisance.
Even so, talking about Rumio gold coins is taking it too far.
Well then...
Guess I will sleep.
This cannot be real.
Hey...
You...
W-Wake up!
What are you doing in my wagon?
I told you to wake up!
Ea-
Ears?
H-Hey...
What a pleasant moon.
Do you have any beer?
I-I do not have anything like that!
In the first place-
What?
Then how about some food?
Oh?
What a waste.
Are you some kind of possessing demon?
How ungrateful.
How dare you point your knife at me.
W-What did you say?
I see, you are not part of the local village.
Sorry, please forget what I said.
My name is Horo.
It is been a while since I last took this form.
It seems it went well.
Horo?
Yes, it is a good name, is it not?
What a coincidence.
I know something that goes by that name as well.
I do not know of anyone named Horo, other than myself.
Where is that person?
It is the name of the god in a village from this area.
Are you telling me you are a god?
I have been called a god for a long time since I was bound to this land.
I am not as great as a real god.
I am nothing but Horo.
She is a girl that is been locked up since she was small, and
she is strange and pathetic,
is probably what you are thinking, right?
I was born in the far North.
North?
Yes, the summers are short and the winters are long.
A forest in the country of Yoitsu.
It was a world where everything sparkled a brilliant silver.
You are a travelling merchant, right?
Could you take me with you?
W-Why me?
I have a good eye for people.
You are not a cold person who can nonchalantly refuse a person's request, are you?
Do not lean on me!
I am not that good of a person!
Could you treat me nicely?
You are just too cute.
I do not dislike this form, but it is too cold.
Horo!
If you are really Kenrou Horo, then prove it to me!
Are you saying you want to see my wolf form?
That is right!
I do not want to.
W-Why is that?
What about you?!
If you are a human, then I will take you to a church and exorcise you.
Possessing demons because great trouble.
But if you are really the Horo who brings an abundant harvest, then I will think it over.
You look like you could bring me great fortune.
Do you really want to see it?
Yes, I do.
I will ask you one more time.
Do you really want to see it?
I really want to see it.
Regardless of the form, I cannot change unless a price is paid.
In my case,
it is blood from the living,
or a bit of wheat.
Take some of the wheat over there, please.
H-Hey.
What is wrong?
Sorry for my sudden return.
No, do not worry.
I will be heading towards the festival, but you can stay here.
Who is it?
It is Horo.
Horo?
You did not bother showing up, so I had to come.
Do not you have to be in the grain barn?
Horo probably does not exist, anyway.
Come on, let us go.
Where to?
You promised you would treat me, right?
You smell differently from before.
Did you pass by Zauchebache?
You have a good sense of smell, as usual.
The smell of the soil and life there just sticks to you naturally.
Your look has changed, too.
It is overflowing with confidence.
Is not it?
It feels great.
I just might surpass you, one day.
I will have to ask for your patronage when that happens.
How mean!
You probably do not think that way at all!
Of course I do.
This beer is good.
Hey, hey, that is enough.
If you start believing in me, then I have a good proposal for you.
If it goes well, we can open up our own store, and even build our own house!
That is amazing.
Come on, take me seriously!
I have a big business negotiation, and we can make a killing off it if it comes together.
Lawrence?
You are really starting to look like your father.
Your father also had a good business sense.
It is not like that, this time.
That is why I am telling you all this.
There are always some strings attached to these big proposals.
Is that why you want to hire me?
I want to partner up with you because I admire you.
I have always taken everything you have told me to heart.
I believe that I have gotten this far because of it.
It is all because of you.
It is dangerous.
It is really dangerous.
You are still young.
Rather than betting on this proposal, it would be better if you gained more experience.
How boring!
It was a chance for us to gain a profit together.
I will bring you some better proposals that are less dangerous.
I will partner up with you on those.
I have grown without you even noticing, you know!
No, you have a long way to go as a merchant.
You will have it coming when you underestimate me.
Experiencing something like that might be good.
Is it a woman?
You looked up to the sky for a moment.
Did you find a good partner?
No.
I was just imagining how it would be if Horo were my partner.
Horo?
You mean me?
No, I mean the real Horo.
I cannot believe it, you were having delusions like that?
Delusions, huh?
Yeah, delusions.
Delusions, you say?
Delusions for sure.
What if Horo actually existed?
Another delusion?
I wonder if she is had painful times, too.
Of course not!
Horo is a god, after all.
I guess.
I guess there is no way she would be here.
Whom are you seeking?
Horo!
You do not need to act so surprised.
Where were you hiding?
During this season, I live inside harvested wheat.
I can never escape.
It is because someone is looking.
But, there is an exception.
Exception?
If there is a bigger stack of wheat than the one that was harvested last,
I can move to that one.
Well, so...
How do I say it...
I guess I can call you my savior.
You are my savior.
During that time,
when I saw your true form,
I was unusually surprised.
Is that why you vanished?
You know,
I was asked for a favor by a young man a long time ago.
I was asked to ripen the wheat for the village.
Since then, I have been protecting it.
However, if abundant harvests repeat, it puts pressure on the land.
I had to let the land rest sometimes.
However, the villagers would say it was my whim that did it.
It is been getting worse these past years.
No one needs me anymore.
Whenever I am needed, they run away scared when they see my true form.
I cannot even get close to them.
That was not what I had wished for.
For now, I will believe that story.
You are such a distrustful man.
Is there a place you want to go, once you leave the village?
I want to return to the North.
Lawrence?
It is all right, you can come out now.
It was quite hard to tie up my shoelaces in there.
Well, of course.
Shoelaces?
Hey, is that my...?
Yes, does it look good?
Those are my best clothes; they took ten years to obtain!
Seems like it.
The tailoring is quite good.
You are a pretty good merchant.
Take those clothes off right now, or get off.
You would not do that.
You will have it coming if you underestimate me.
Anyway, I am counting on you, um...
Lawrence.
Craft, Lawrence.
Lawrence.
In the future, your name shall be in my tales for eternity!
Geez, you do not need to talk about me.
Get your own meals, okay?
I am not in an easy business.
I am not such a fool to think that I would get free meals just like that.
I am Horo Kenrou, the prideful wolf.
Anyway...
It is a bit confined.
Listen here...
Well, it will be a good way for me to get used to the cold.
ED
Seven apples on the witch's tree
With seven seeds to plant inside of me
In spring time I grew a magic song
Then skipping along,
I sang the song to everyone
I look at the world through apple eyes
And cut myself a slice of sunshine pie
I danced with the peanuts for the flies
Till someone had told me
To say hello for every good-bye
Saw some sugar stars
I will put them in a jar
And we will wish around the world
Oh we will wish around the world
I am a little wolf inside a cart
You say,
And off I go from June to May
Oh we will wish around the world
Let us wish around the world
Next, Wolf and Distant Past.
Next, Wolf and Distant Past.
